column2: Mistress Jenny Wren took possession of the little box nailed to a tree immediately in front of Mr. Philip's house. She had not really moved in
column3: when who should peep in but Mr. English-Sparrow.He was abroad house hunting
column4: and never mistrusted that anyone had got this house before him. He was thinking how well it would suit himself and mate
column5: when whir-r-r-r! whir-r-r-r! up came Mrs. Jenny: and before he could offer a word of excuse
column8: fie! I took you for a gentleman! What business have you here?""My dear madam
column9: began Mr. Sparrow; but Jenny would not hear him. Out
column12: you interloper!" she screamed; and she dashed at him and pecked him till he beat a speedy retreat.The next day
column14: he came round again; whether to express his regrets in due form
column16: I cannot say; but Mrs. Jenny was unwilling to accept anything but the most humble apology.
